comments.body: is it possible to add a function to create a project?
Thanks for your comment earlier - I (a bit belatedly) added a couple of project methods, is this what you had in mind?
is this supposed to be `"workspace" in search_parameters`?

I can definitely see how the intent of that line could be confusing, but no - I wanted to only use the default workspace parameter if the user didn't provide a project ID when they called `find_task` (i.e. let the user override the default workspace ID with a more specific project ID). If instead the user wants to override the default workspace with another workspace id, that gets handled in the next couple of lines. Added a comment to clarify the intended behavior!
Please describe the `params` argument in docstring in all methods. The name is vague and having docstring will help users understand what should there be passed

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +202,206 @@        return response

    def create_project(self, params: dict) -> dict:
        """
        Creates a new project.
